title: 1977 Dodge D100 Warlock Utiline 360 at No Reserve
description: This 1977 Dodge D100 Warlock is a ½-ton pickup that was registered to the previous owner from the mid 1980s until the selling dealer's recent acquisition, and it now shows 78k miles. The truck is powered by a 360ci V8 linked to a three-speed automatic transmission, and it is finished in Bright Red over black vinyl. Additional equipment includes front disc brakes, 15" eight-spoke wheels, a Utiline bed, a bench seat, manually operated windows, an AM radio, and a heater. This D-Series pickup is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean New Jersey title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 1977 Dodge D100 Warlock Utiline 360 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #176,835.
text: This 1977 Dodge D100 Warlock is a ½-ton pickup that was registered to the previous owner from the mid 1980s until the selling dealer’s recent acquisition, and it now shows 78k miles. The truck is powered by a 360ci V8 linked to a three-speed automatic transmission, and it is finished in Bright Red over black vinyl. Additional equipment includes front disc brakes, 15″ eight-spoke wheels, a Utiline bed, a bench seat, manually operated windows, an AM radio, and a heater. This D-Series pickup is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean New Jersey title. Part of Dodge’s mid-1970s “Adult Toys” lineup, the Warlock was based on the Dodge ½-ton Utiline stepside pickups and included specific trim and graphics, plus a pair of oak sideboards. This example is finished in Bright Red, and exterior features include Custom badges, a driver-side mirror, and a dropdown tailgate. The selling dealer states various body panels have been repainted. Gold-finished 15″ eight-spoke wheels are mounted with Goodyear tires. Stopping power is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes. The emergency brake cable was replaced in preparation for the sale. The cabin features a bench seat upholstered in black vinyl, and interior appointments include a heater, an AM radio, and wind-up windows. The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 78k miles. The 360ci V8 sends power to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission. The radiator was replaced in preparation for the sale. html:
This 1977 Dodge D100 Warlock is a ½-ton pickup that was registered to the previous owner from the mid 1980s until the selling dealer’s recent acquisition, and it now shows 78k miles. The truck is powered by a 360ci V8 linked to a three-speed automatic transmission, and it is finished in Bright Red over black vinyl. Additional equipment includes front disc brakes, 15″ eight-spoke wheels, a Utiline bed, a bench seat, manually operated windows, an AM radio, and a heater. This D-Series pickup is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a clean New Jersey title.

Part of Dodge’s mid-1970s “Adult Toys” lineup, the Warlock was based on the Dodge ½-ton Utiline stepside pickups and included specific trim and graphics, plus a pair of oak sideboards. This example is finished in Bright Red, and exterior features include Custom badges, a driver-side mirror, and a dropdown tailgate. The selling dealer states various body panels have been repainted.

Gold-finished 15″ eight-spoke wheels are mounted with Goodyear tires. Stopping power is provided by front disc and rear drum brakes. The emergency brake cable was replaced in preparation for the sale.

The cabin features a bench seat upholstered in black vinyl, and interior appointments include a heater, an AM radio, and wind-up windows.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 100-mph speedometer and auxiliary gauges. The five-digit odometer shows 78k miles.

The 360ci V8 sends power to the rear wheels through a three-speed automatic transmission. The radiator was replaced in preparation for the sale.

Additional underside photos are provided in the gallery.
